explicit

Class STPGAbstrSimple

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.ModelExplicit
      • explicit.STPGAbstrSimple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Model, ModelSimple, NondetModel, NondetModelSimple, STPG

    public class STPGAbstrSimple
extends ModelExplicit
implements STPG, NondetModelSimple
    Simple explicit-state representation of a stochastic two-player game (STPG), as used for abstraction of MDPs, i.e. with strict cycling between player 1, player 2 and probabilistic states. Thus, we store this a set of sets of distributions for each state. This means that the player 2 states are not true states, i.e. they don't count for statistics and player 1 states are treated as successors of each other.

      Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob0, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for all/some player 1 choices, for all/some player 2 choices, there is a transition to a state in u.
      void prob1step(java.util.BitSet subset, java.util.BitSet u, java.util.BitSet v, boolean forall1, boolean forall2, java.util.BitSet result)
      Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for all/some player 1 choices, for all/some player 2 choices, there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u.

      • newDistributionSet

        public DistributionSet newDistributionSet(java.lang.Object action)
        Creates a new distribution set suitable for passing to addDistributionSet(...) i.e. a data structure consistent with the internals of the this class. An optional action label (any Object type) can be specified; null if not needed.

      • addDistributionSet

        public int addDistributionSet(int s,
                              DistributionSet newSet)
        Add distribution set 'newSet' to state s (which must exist). Distribution set is only actually added if it does not already exists for state s. (Assuming 'allowDupes' flag is not enabled.) Returns the index of the (existing or newly added) set. Returns -1 in case of error.

      • findDeadlocks

        public void findDeadlocks(boolean fix)
                   throws PrismException
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Find all deadlock states and store this information in the model. If requested (if fix=true) and if needed (i.e. for DTMCs/CTMCs), fix deadlocks by adding self-loops in these states. The set of deadlocks (before any possible fixing) can be obtained from Model.getDeadlockStates().
        Specified by:
        findDeadlocks in interface Model
        Throws:
        PrismException - if the model is unable to fix deadlocks because it is non-mutable.

      • prob0step

        public void prob0step(java.util.BitSet subset,
                      java.util.BitSet u,
                      boolean forall1,
                      boolean forall2,
                      java.util.BitSet result)
        Description copied from interface: STPG
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob0, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for all/some player 1 choices, for all/some player 2 choices, there is a transition to a state in u. Quantification over player 1/2 choices is determined by forall1, forall2.
        Specified by:
        prob0step in interface STPG
        Parameters:
        subset - Only compute for these states
        u - Set of states u
        forall1 - For-all or there-exists for player 1 (true=for-all, false=there-exists)
        result - Store results here

      • prob1step

        public void prob1step(java.util.BitSet subset,
                      java.util.BitSet u,
                      java.util.BitSet v,
                      boolean forall1,
                      boolean forall2,
                      java.util.BitSet result)
        Description copied from interface: STPG
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for all/some player 1 choices, for all/some player 2 choices, there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u. Quantification over player 1/2 choices is determined by forall1, forall2.
        Specified by:
        prob1step in interface STPG
        Parameters:
        subset - Only compute for these states
        u - Set of states u
        v - Set of states v
        result - Store results here

      • mvMultMinMax

        public void mvMultMinMax(double[] vect,
                         boolean min1,
                         boolean min2,
                         double[] result,
                         java.util.BitSet subset,
                         boolean complement,
                         int[] adv)
        Description copied from interface: STPG
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication followed by two min/max ops, i.e. one step of value iteration, i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_{k1,k2} { sum_j P_{k1,k2}(s,j)*vect[j] }
        Specified by:
        mvMultMinMax in interface STPG
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        min1 - Min or max for player 1 (true=min, false=max)
        min2 - Min or max for player 2 (true=min, false=max)
        result - Vector to store result in
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        adv - Storage for adversary choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultGSMinMax

        public double mvMultGSMinMax(double[] vect,
                             boolean min1,
                             boolean min2,
                             java.util.BitSet subset,
                             boolean complement,
                             boolean absolute)
        Description copied from interface: STPG
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = min/max_{k1,k2} { (sum_{j!=s} P_{k1,k2}(s,j)*vect[j]) / P_{k1,k2}(s,s) } and store new values directly in vect as computed. The maximum (absolute/relative) difference between old/new elements of vect is also returned.
        Specified by:
        mvMultGSMinMax in interface STPG
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        min1 - Min or max for player 1 (true=min, false=max)
        min2 - Min or max for player 2 (true=min, false=max)
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        absolute - If true, compute absolute, rather than relative, difference
        Returns:
        The maximum difference between old/new elements of vect

      • mvMultJacMinMaxSingle

        public double mvMultJacMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                    double[] vect,
                                    boolean min1,
                                    boolean min2)
        Description copied from interface: STPG
        Do a single row of Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_{k1,k2} { (sum_{j!=s} P_{k1,k2}(s,j)*vect[j]) / P_{k1,k2}(s,s) }
        Specified by:
        mvMultJacMinMaxSingle in interface STPG
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        min1 - Min or max for player 1 (true=min, false=max)
        min2 - Min or max for player 2 (true=min, false=max)

      • mvMultRewMinMax

        public void mvMultRewMinMax(double[] vect,
                            STPGRewards rewards,
                            boolean min1,
                            boolean min2,
                            double[] result,
                            java.util.BitSet subset,
                            boolean complement,
                            int[] adv)
        Description copied from interface: STPG
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication and sum of action reward followed by min/max, i.e. one step of value iteration. i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_{k1,k2} { rew(s) + sum_j P_{k1,k2}(s,j)*vect[j] }
        Specified by:
        mvMultRewMinMax in interface STPG
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        min1 - Min or max for player 1 (true=min, false=max)
        min2 - Min or max for player 2 (true=min, false=max)
        result - Vector to store result in
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        adv - Storage for adversary choice indices (ignored if null)
